column4: I'm working on porting some networking stuff for my business from windows to Ubuntu. It was originally written in .NET, so I was considering MonoDevelop; then I heard of KDevelop (C++), which also worked amazingly well. So I was wondering if anything is 'better' about using KDevelop or MonoDevelop as an IDE.
go with monodevelop if you use Mono
for C++, use eclipse + CDT. Much better than whatever else
not sure, but you can simply pull mono from their original repos, which has the last developments
